intro: Navarretia leptalea subsp. leptalea, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal bluffs. It produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas. Navarretia leptalea subsp. leptalea is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to thrive in mild, coastal climates.
